result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph L Sattler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph L Sattler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph L Sattler was found guilty of Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 7 days credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail on deposit to be applied to Costs.  Remaining balance to be refunded to poster.
AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Maintain/Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week)  within the first 30 days of probation.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Review obtaining a valid driver's license.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed as a condition of probation.  To be completed within the first 6 months of probation, as directed by Agent.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph L Sattler

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:18 AM Defendant Joseph L Sattler in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for Jury status hearing.
Parties have reached an agreement.
State filed an amended information.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 is dismissed outright.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 2:
Withheld sentence (Credit for 7 days if revoked)

Term of Probation: 12 Months
Conditions of Probation:
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; 
-	Random U.A.s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	Maintain/Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within  the first 30 days of probation;
-	Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.
-	Review obtaining a valid Driver's License;
-	Complete 20 hours Community Service within the first 6 months of probation

COSTS:  $ 243.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining cash bail to be refunded to poster.

Jury status hearing on May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:26 AM Defendant Joseph L Sattler in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant confirms address and phone number.
Defense requests matter be set for trial.  Jury trial expected to last 2 days.  Court will select an alternate.  Each party to have 5 strikes.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.
  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:00 PM Defendant Joseph L Sattler in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
